intro: Argostemma nervosum, commonly known as the veined argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are small, tubular, and typically yellow or white, arranged in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
